Our engineering team is actively investigating. We will update in 1 hour or as soon as we have more information. Dec 14, 14:06 PST Investigating - Our monitoring systems have detected a potential issue with with Programmable Messaging. Our engineering team has been alerted and is actively investigating. We will update as soon as we have more information.

entry.title: Incident: Some users having trouble playing videos
entry.summary: We’ve resolved the issue concerning video playback quality affecting some users. You may need to reload Slack (Command/Ctrl + Shift + R) in order for this fix to be reflected on your end. We’re sorry for the disruption we brought to your day.

entry.title: Incident: Trouble connecting in Slack
entry.summary:
Issue summary:
From 10:12 AM PST until 10:25 AM PST on December 14, 2022, some customers had trouble loading Slack workspaces, sending messages, and uploading files.
Prior to this issue, we began removing traffic from an isolated location within a data center region as part of a planned exercise. Upon further investigation, we identified a bug within this process. We then stopped the process, which resolved the issue for all users. Error rates were monitored for a short while prior to announcing the resolution, in order to ensure the issue was fully resolved and would not reoccur.

entry.title: Devices Using Super SIM May Have Experienced Degraded Connectivity
entry.summary: Dec 13, 22:15 PST Resolved - Super SIM connectivity was degraded for 18 minutes between 21:24 and 21:42 PT on 12/13/2022. During this period, customers may have experienced delays in getting connected to the network. At the same time we noticed that 2.2% of devices lost data connectivity. Devices that attempted to reconnect immediately after losing connectivity should have been able to successfully reconnect to the redundant instances while the impacted one recovered. The issue has now been resolved.

entry.title: RESOLVED: We are experiencing an issue with Gmail, Google Chat, Google Voice. Our engineering team continues to investigate the issue. We will provide an update by Tuesday, 2022-12-13 10:30 US/Pacific with current details. Users may be facing unavailability for Gmail, Google Chat and Google Voice
entry.summary:
Incident began at 2022-12-13 15:34 and ended at 2022-12-13 18:04 (times are in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC)).

Upon further investigation, our engineering teams believe that the scope is very limited and/or no customers of Gmail were impacted.

The Mini Incident Report impacting Google Voice and Google Chat is available on the https://www.google.com/appsstatus/dashboard/incidents/AzeVS1iCHxhtzgi8r3mc while we prepare a full Issue Summary Report.

Affected products: Gmail

entry.title: Incident: Trouble with exports
entry.summary:
Issue Summary:
From December 8, 2022 at 03:15 PST to December 8, 2022 at 05:10 PST, some customers may have experienced issues with exports failing. This was due to a lack of disk space on one of the hosts running export jobs. We fixed this issue by terminating the host which resolved the problem for all affected customers.

We'll post updates as we have more information.

entry.title: Incident: Some users may be experiencing issues loading DMs or channels
entry.summary:
Issue summary:
From December 1, 2022 at 12:10 PM PST to December 5, 2022 at 2:43 PM PST, some customers may have experienced issues with blank channels and direct message conversations.
We made a small change to improve the screen reader experience that inadvertently introduced a syntax error. We corrected this error, resolving the problem for all affected customers.

entry.title: Incident with Git Operations and Pull Requests
entry.summary: Dec 5, 18:40 UTC Resolved - This incident has been resolved. Dec 5, 18:07 UTC Update - We have identified possible causes slowing down git operations including push and pull for a small number of customers, as well as some slow merge operations and are working on mitigating now. Dec 5, 17:31 UTC Investigating - We are investigating reports of degraded performance for Git Operations and Pull Requests.

entry.title: Incident: Some customers may be experiencing issues with custom emoji reactions disappearing
entry.summary:
Issue summary:
From December 1, 2022, 1:00 PM PST, to December 1, 2022, 6:30 PM PST, some of our users ran into an issue where custom emoji containing non-ASCII characters disappeared after being used as reactions.
A backend change to our emoji validation process caused some emojis with non-ASCII characters to be rejected.
Your emoji reactions should now be back to normal.

entry.title: Incident: Issues with SMS two-factor authentication for some customers
entry.summary:
Issue summary:
On December 4, 2022, from 5:00 PM PST to 11:14 PM, users ran into trouble where they did not receive 2FA codes on SMS, making them unable to log into Slack as a result. This issue was due to a service provider's slow processing rate.
To fix this, we sorted out the processing backlog together with the service provider. We then had them raise the country specific processing rate limit, resolving the issue for our customers.

We will continue to keep users updated on progress towards mitigation. Nov 30, 16:02 UTC Investigating - We are currently investigating this issue.

entry.title: Incident: Some users may be experiencing connectivity issues.
entry.summary:
On Tuesday November 29th from 10:32am PST to 2:07pm PST, customers in some regions began noticing connection issue with Slack.
An automation from an upstream DNS service accidentally blocked slack.com queries in a limited region (mostly the Northeast US).
After communication with the upstream provider, the issue was identified and corrected. Impacted users should have no further issues connecting to Slack.

entry.title: Incident with Codespaces
entry.summary: Nov 29, 17:05 UTC Resolved - This incident has been resolved. Nov 29, 16:43 UTC Investigating - We are investigating reports of degraded performance for Codespaces.

entry.title: New feature - Automated discount codes by Smily!
entry.summary:
New!
As we all know, retaining guests and providing them an incentive to book directly with you, or rewarding their loyalty, is key. The current non-automated solutions are time-consuming and require a lot of effort from you and your guests. After several workshops with Smily users, reflections, and feedback, our Smily team designed an elegant and flexible solution to meet your various needs. Say hello to our new functionality: “Discount codes” A powerful marketing tool that allows you to create customized discounts. with different values for all rentals, or specific ones! How can I use this feature? In a few easy steps explained in our demo video: Watch the video For more details please follow the steps in the link below: Read the article Still have some availability on your calendar? 🎁 Give your previous guests a nice Christmas gift and send them a discount code to book their next trip with you during the low season. 💡For guests who book on the channels, offer them a special discount after their stay if they book on your website for their next trip. 😎 Offer a discount to all the guests who booked with you as a reward to use personally or to share with their family or friends. With the new Smily discount code you will save time and book even more! Wishing you all a pleasant day! Smily Team

entry.title: Incident: Issues with search in Slack
entry.summary:
Issue summary:
From November 23, 2022 at 7:30pm PST to November 23, 2022 at 8:22pm PST, some users were unable to send messages, load content or use workflows within Slack. We discovered the issue was related to a recent change which accidentally severed access to a number of endpoints. A network change was made and most services started to auto-recover and work again.
During the restore process some users experienced search errors or slow responses within the search bar. This was resolved on November 24, 2022 at 5:58pm PST, restoring functionality for all affected users.

We are monitoring the situation and will resolve the incident soon. Please retry any requests that may have failed with 500 Errors. Nov 20, 20:48 PST Investigating - We are currently investigating elevated rates of 500 Errors when attempting to update Async Calendars API.

entry.title: TS-2022-004
entry.summary: Reference: CVE-2022-41924 Severity: Critical CVSS vector string: CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:R/S:C/C:H/I:L/A:H Description: A vulnerability identified in the Tailscale Windows client allows a malicious website to reconfigure the Tailscale daemon tailscaled, which can then be used to remotely execute code. Affected platforms: Windows Patched Tailscale client versions: v1.32.3 or later, v1.33.257 or later (unstable) What happened? In the Tailscale Windows client, the local API was bound to a local TCP socket, and communicated with the Windows client GUI in cleartext with no Host header verification. This allowed an attacker-controlled website visited by the node to rebind DNS to an attacker-controlled DNS server, and then make local API requests in the client, including changing the coordination server to an attacker-controlled coordination server. Who is affected? All Windows clients prior to version v1.32.3 are affected. What should I do? If you are running Tailscale on Windows, upgrade to v1.32.3 or later to remediate the issue. What is the impact? An attacker-controlled coordination server can send malicious URL responses to the client, including pushing executables or installing an SMB share. These allow the attacker to remotely execute code on the node. Reviewing all logs confirms this vulnerability was not triggered or exploited. Credits We would like to thank Emily Trau and Jamie McClymont (CyberCX) for reporting this issue. Further detail is available in their blog post.

entry.title: TS-2022-005
entry.summary: Reference: CVE-2022-41925 Severity: Low CVSS vector string: CVSS:3.0/AV:A/AC:L/PR:N/UI:R/S:C/C:L/I:N/A:N Description: A vulnerability identified in the Tailscale client allows a malicious website to access the peer API, which can then be used to access Tailscale environment variables. Affected platforms: All Patched Tailscale client versions: v1.32.3 or later, v1.33.257 or later (unstable) What happened? In the Tailscale client, the peer API was vulnerable to DNS rebinding. This allowed an attacker-controlled website visited by the node to rebind DNS for the peer API to an attacker-controlled DNS server, and then making peer API requests in the client, including accessing the node’s Tailscale environment variables. Who is affected? All Tailscale clients prior to version v1.32.3 are affected. What should I do? Upgrade to v1.32.3 or later to remediate the issue. What is the impact? An attacker with access to the peer API on a node could use that access to read the node’s environment variables, including any credentials or secrets stored in environment variables. This may include Tailscale authentication keys, which could then be used to add new nodes to the user’s tailnet. The peer API access could also be used to learn of other nodes in the tailnet or send files via Taildrop. An attacker with access to the peer API who sent a malicious file via Taildrop which was accessed while it was loading could use this to gain access to the local API, and remotely execute code. There is no evidence of this vulnerability being purposefully triggered or exploited. Credits We would like to thank Emily Trau and Jamie McClymont (CyberCX) for reporting this issue. Further detail is available in their blog post.
